meanings.definition: A person or thing that causes annoyance or distress.
meanings.sent1: The noisy neighbors are the vexers in our building.
meanings.sent2: The vexers at school always disrupt the class with their pranks.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat became the vexers of the household by knocking over plants.
meanings.sent4: The constant buzzing of the mosquito vexers me like a persistent itch.
meanings.sent5: The persistent telemarketers are the vexers of my peaceful evenings.

meanings.definition: Plural form of the word 'vexer', meaning those who annoy or distress others.
meanings.sent1: The vexers in the park were causing trouble for the visitors.
meanings.sent2: The group of vexers in the office always gossip and spread rumors.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppies turned into little vexers when they chewed on the shoes.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds gathered like vexers, threatening to ruin the picnic.
meanings.sent5: The persistent raindrops were the vexers of the outdoor event.
